cache_inode_rdwr.c

Go to the documentation of this file.

00098 #include "LRU_List.h"
00099 #include "log_functions.h"

00106 #include <unistd.h>
00107 #include <sys/types.h>
00108 #include <sys/stat.h>
00109 #include <sys/param.h>
00110 #include <time.h>
00111 #include <pthread.h>
00112 
00137 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_rdwr( cache_entry_t              * pentry, 
00138                                        cache_inode_io_direction_t   read_or_write,
00139                                        fsal_seek_t                * seek_descriptor,
00140                                        fsal_size_t                  buffer_size,  
00141                                        fsal_size_t                * pio_size,
00142                                        fsal_attrib_list_t         * pfsal_attr,
00143                                        caddr_t                      buffer,    
00144                                        fsal_boolean_t             * p_fsal_eof,
00145                                        hash_table_t               * ht,  
00146                                        cache_inode_client_t       * pclient, 
00147                                        fsal_op_context_t          * pcontext, 
00148                                        cache_inode_status_t       * pstatus )
00149 {
00150   int                          statindex = 0 ;
00151   cache_content_io_direction_t io_direction ;
00152   cache_content_status_t       cache_content_status ;
00153   fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
00154   fsal_openflags_t             openflags ;
00155   fsal_size_t                  io_size ;
00156   fsal_attrib_list_t           post_write_attr; 
00157   fsal_status_t                fsal_status_getattr ;
00158   struct stat                  buffstat ;
00159  
00160   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00161   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00162 
00163   /* For now, only FSAL_SEEK_SET is supported */
00164   if( seek_descriptor->whence != FSAL_SEEK_SET )
00165     {
00166       DisplayLogJd( pclient->log_outputs, 
00167                     "Implementation trouble: seek_descriptor was not a 'FSAL_SEEK_SET' cursor" ) ;
00168       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00169       return *pstatus ;
00170     }
00171   
00172                     
00173   io_size = buffer_size ;
00174 
00175 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00176   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00177                      "---> INODE : IO Size = %llu fdsize =%d seeksize=%d",
00178                      buffer_size , sizeof( fsal_file_t ), sizeof( fsal_seek_t ) ) ;
00179 #endif
00180 
00181   /* stat */
00182   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00183   if( read_or_write == CACHE_INODE_READ )
00184     {
00185       statindex    = CACHE_INODE_READ_DATA;
00186       io_direction = CACHE_CONTENT_READ ;
00187       openflags    = FSAL_O_RDONLY ;
00188       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_READ_DATA] += 1 ;
00189     }
00190   else
00191     {
00192       statindex    = CACHE_INODE_WRITE_DATA ;
00193       io_direction = CACHE_CONTENT_WRITE ;
00194       openflags    = FSAL_O_WRONLY ;
00195       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_WRITE_DATA] += 1 ;
00196     }
00197 
00198    P_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00199   
00200    /* IO are done only on REGULAR_FILEs */
00201    if( pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
00202     {
00203       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
00204       V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00205 
00206       /* stats */
00207       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00208       
00209       return *pstatus ;
00210     }
00211 
00212    /* Non absolute address within the file are not supported (we act only like pread/pwrite) */
00213    if( seek_descriptor->whence != FSAL_SEEK_SET )
00214      {
00215        *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00216        V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00217        
00218       /* stats */
00219        pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00220        
00221        return *pstatus ;
00222      }
00223 
00224     /* Calls file content cache to operate on the cache */
00225    if( pentry->object.file.pentry_content != NULL )
00226      {
00227        /* Entry is data cached */
00228        cache_content_rdwr( pentry->object.file.pentry_content, 
00229                            io_direction,
00230                            seek_descriptor, 
00231                            &io_size,
00232                            pio_size,
00233                            buffer, 
00234                            p_fsal_eof,
00235                            &buffstat,
00236                            (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00237                            pcontext, 
00238                            &cache_content_status ) ;
00239 
00240        /* If the entry under resync */
00241        if( cache_content_status == CACHE_CONTENT_LOCAL_CACHE_NOT_FOUND )
00242          {
00243            /* Data cache gc has removed this entry */
00244           if(  cache_content_new_entry( pentry,
00245                                         NULL,
00246                                         (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
00247                                          RENEW_ENTRY,
00248                                          pcontext,
00249                                          &cache_content_status ) == NULL )
00250             { 
00251                /* Entry could not be recoverd, cache_content_status contains an error, let it be managed by the next block */
00252                DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00253                                  "Read/Write Operation through cache failed with status %d (renew process failed)",     
00254                                   cache_content_status ) ;
00255 
00256             } 
00257            else
00258             {
00259                 /* Entry was successfully renewed */
00260                 DisplayLog( "----> File Content Entry %p was successfully renewed", pentry ) ;
00261 
00262                 /* Try to access the content of the file again */
00263                 cache_content_rdwr( pentry->object.file.pentry_content,
00264                                     io_direction,
00265                                     seek_descriptor,
00266                                     &io_size,
00267                                     pio_size,
00268                                     buffer,
00269                                     p_fsal_eof,
00270                                     &buffstat,
00271                                     (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
00272                                     pcontext,
00273                                     &cache_content_status ) ;
00274 
00275                 /* No management of cache_content_status in case of failure, this will be done 
00276                  * within the next block */
00277             }
00278                 
00279          }
00280 
00281 
00282        if( cache_content_status != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ) 
00283          {
00284            *pstatus = cache_content_error_convert( cache_content_status ) ;
00285 
00286            V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00287               
00288            DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
00289                               "Read/Write Operation through cache failed with status %d",cache_content_status ) ;
00290          
00291            
00292            /* stats */
00293            pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00294            
00295            return *pstatus ;
00296          }
00297 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE    
00298        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00299                           "inode/dc: io_size=%llu, pio_size=%llu,  eof=%d, seek=%d.%llu", 
00300                           io_size, *pio_size, *p_fsal_eof, seek_descriptor->whence, seek_descriptor->offset ) ;
00301   
00302        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG,
00303                           "---> INODE  AFTER : IO Size = %llu %llu", io_size, *pio_size ) ;
00304 #endif
00305      
00306         /* Use information from the buffstat to update the file metadata */
00307         pentry->object.file.attributes.filesize = buffstat.st_size ;
00308         pentry->object.file.attributes.spaceused = buffstat.st_blksize * buffstat.st_blocks ;  
00309 
00310      }
00311    else
00312      {
00313        /* No data cache entry, we operated directly on FSAL */
00314        pentry->object.file.attributes.asked_attributes =  pclient->attrmask ;
00315 
00316 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL 
00317        printf("cache_inode_rdwr: pentry %p: fd=%u\n", pentry, pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno);
00318 #endif
00319        
00320        /* Open the file if needed */
00321        if( pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno < 0 ) 
00322          {
00323            if( cache_inode_open( pentry, 
00324                                 pclient, 
00325                                 openflags,
00326                                 pcontext,
00327                                 pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
00328             {
00329               V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00330            
00331               /* stats */
00332               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00333            
00334               return *pstatus ;
00335             } 
00336          }
00337        
00338        /* Call FSAL_read or FSAL_write */
00339 
00340        switch( read_or_write )
00341          {
00342          case CACHE_INODE_READ:
00343 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00344            fsal_status = MFSL_read( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 
00345                                     seek_descriptor, 
00346                                     io_size, 
00347                                     buffer, 
00348                                     pio_size, 
00349                                     p_fsal_eof,
00350                                     &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00351 #else
00352            fsal_status = FSAL_read( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 
00353                                     seek_descriptor, 
00354                                     io_size, 
00355                                     buffer, 
00356                                     pio_size, 
00357                                     p_fsal_eof ) ;
00358 #endif
00359            break ;
00360            
00361          case CACHE_INODE_WRITE:
00362 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00363            fsal_status = MFSL_write( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 
00364                                      seek_descriptor, 
00365                                      io_size, 
00366                                      buffer, 
00367                                      pio_size,
00368                                      &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00369 #else
00370            fsal_status = FSAL_write( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 
00371                                      seek_descriptor, 
00372                                      io_size, 
00373                                      buffer, 
00374                                      pio_size ) ;
00375 #endif
00376  
00377            break ;
00378          }
00379        
00380        if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) )
00381          {
00382            *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00383 
00384            if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_DELAY )
00385              DisplayLogJd( pclient->log_outputs, "FSAL_write returned EBUSY" ) ;
00386            else
00387              DisplayLogJd( pclient->log_outputs, "cache_inode_rdwr: fsal_status.major = %d", fsal_status.major ) ;
00388 #ifdef _USE_MFSL 
00389           MFSL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), &pclient->mfsl_context ) ;
00390 #else
00391           FSAL_close( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd) ) ;
00392 #endif
00393           pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op = 0 ;
00394           pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno = -1 ;
00395            
00396           V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00397           
00398           /* stats */
00399           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00400           
00401           return *pstatus ;
00402         } 
00403 
00404                                      
00405 #ifndef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00406        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00407                           "inode/direct: io_size=%llu, pio_size=%llu, eof=%d, seek=%d.%llu", 
00408                           io_size, *pio_size, *p_fsal_eof, seek_descriptor->whence, seek_descriptor->offset ) ;
00409 #endif
00410         
00411        if( cache_inode_close( pentry, pclient, pstatus ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )  
00412          {
00413            V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00414            
00415            /* stats */
00416            pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[statindex] += 1 ;
00417            
00418            return *pstatus ;
00419          } 
00420 
00421        if( read_or_write == CACHE_INODE_WRITE ) 
00422           {
00423              /* Do a getattr in order to have update information on filesize 
00424               * This query is done directly on FSAL (object is not data cached), and result
00425               * will be propagated to Cache Inode */
00426               
00427              /* WARNING: This operation is to be done AFTER FSAL_close (some FSAL, like POSIX, 
00428               * may not flush data until the file is closed */
00429 
00430              /*post_write_attr.asked_attributes =  pclient->attrmask ; */
00431              post_write_attr.asked_attributes =  FSAL_ATTR_SIZE | FSAL_ATTR_SPACEUSED ;
00432              fsal_status_getattr = FSAL_getattrs(  &(pentry->object.file.handle), pcontext, &post_write_attr ) ;
00433 
00434              /* if failed, the next block will handle the error */
00435              if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status_getattr ) ) 
00436                fsal_status = fsal_status_getattr ;
00437             else
00438                {
00439                  /* Update Cache Inode attributes */
00440                  pentry->object.file.attributes.filesize = post_write_attr.filesize ;
00441                  pentry->object.file.attributes.spaceused = post_write_attr.spaceused ;
00442                }
00443           }
00444 
00445      }
00446    
00447    /* IO was successfull (through cache content or not), we manually update the times in the attributes */
00448 
00449    switch( read_or_write ) 
00450     {
00451      case CACHE_INODE_READ:
00452        /* Set the atime */
00453        pentry->object.file.attributes.atime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ;
00454        pentry->object.file.attributes.atime.nseconds = 0 ;
00455        break ;
00456        
00457      case CACHE_INODE_WRITE:
00458        /* Set mtime and ctime */
00459        pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime.seconds  = time( NULL ) ;
00460        pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime.nseconds = 0 ;
00461        
00462        /* BUGAZOMEU : write operation must NOT modify file's ctime */
00463        pentry->object.file.attributes.ctime = pentry->object.file.attributes.mtime;
00464        
00465        break ;
00466      }
00467   
00468    /* Return attributes to caller */ 
00469    if( pfsal_attr != NULL ) 
00470         *pfsal_attr = pentry->object.file.attributes ;
00471 
00472    *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00473 
00474    /* stat */
00475    if( read_or_write == CACHE_INODE_READ )
00476      {
00477        *pstatus =  cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ;
00478 
00479        if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00480          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_READ] += 1 ;
00481        else
00482          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_READ] += 1 ;
00483      }
00484    else
00485      {
00486        *pstatus =  cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_SET, pclient ) ;
00487        
00488        if( *pstatus != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00489          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_WRITE] += 1 ;
00490        else
00491          pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_WRITE] += 1 ;
00492      }
00493      
00494    V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;      
00495      
00496    return *pstatus ;
00497 } /* cache_inode_rdwr */
00498
